column2: HIGHLIGHTS•No new countries reported cases of COVID-19 in the past 24 hours.•ThroughtheInternationalFoodSafetyAuthoritiesNetwork(INFOSAN),nationalfoodsafetyauthoritiesareseekingmoreinformationonthepotential for persistence of SARS-CoV-2, which causes COVID-19, on foodstraded internationally as well as the potential role of food in the transmissionof the virus. Currently, there are investigations conducted to evaluate theviability and survival time of SARS-CoV-2. As a general rule, the consumptionof raw or undercooked animal products should be avoided. Raw meat, rawmilkorrawanimalorgansshouldbehandledwithcaretoavoidcross-contamination with uncooked foods.
